intro: Notylia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered notylia, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and white, producing copious nectar that attracts various pollinators. Notylia multiflora is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
